text: Thomas Hale Boggs Sr. (February 15, 1914 – disappeared October 16, 1972) was an American Democratic politician and a member of the U.S. House of Representatives from New Orleans, Louisiana. He was the House majority leader and a member of the Warren Commission. In October 1972, Boggs was travelling with congressman Nick Begich, of Alaska, and two others when the plane disappeared while flying from Anchorage to Juneau, Alaska. He was declared dead in declared dead in absentia in December 1972. ==Related pages== *List of people who disappeared mysteriously: 1910–1990 ==References== ==Other websites== * * * Hale Boggs Telex — Debunked * * Category:1914 births Category:1972 deaths Category:People declared dead in absentia Category:Missing American people Category:Aviation deaths in the United States Category:United States representatives from Louisiana Category:Politicians from Mississippi Category:Democratic Party (United States) politicians Category:Majority leaders of the United States House of Representatives Category:Politicians elected posthumously
title: Hale Boggs
